contentrichtext.text: '''Norman Sherry''' (born 6 July 1935 in [[Newcastle Upon Tyne]], [[England]]) is an [[England|English]] born [[United States|American]] [[novelist]], [[biographer]], and [[educator]] who is most well known for his three-volume biography of the [[United Kingdom|British]] novelist [[Graham Greene]]. Sherry is a Fellow of the [[Royal Society of Literature]]. He has also written on [[Joseph Conrad]], [[Charlotte Brontë|Charlotte]] and [[Emily Brontë]], and [[Jane Austen]]. Volume 1 of his ''Life of Graham Greene'', and volume 2 "one of the Best Eleven Books of 1995" by the editors of [[The New York Review of Books]].{{cn|date=January 2012}} Since 1983, Sherry has held the post of Mitchell Distinguished Professor of Literature at [[Trinity University (Texas)|Trinity University]] in [[San Antonio, Texas|San Antonio]], [[Texas]].
